questions.quote: All right. Elaine, David, I believe we have a deal here in principle: Arby's no more than once a month. And in exchange, Elaine comes to your softball game, and doesn't read a book.
Your father gave me strict orders not to turn the jacket over to anyone, but I suppose I can make an exception in your case. The closet's this way.
Elaine, please, it was a long time ago. The man doesn't want a history lesson.
You were full. So you gave a reason. You didn't just shake your head.
Alright, come on, Newman. Now you gotta help me! What am I gonna do about FDR?
Well, Kramer was right. My friend Kim told me the sponge is off the market.
Well, what does he do? Is he an artisan, a craftsman, a labourer of some sort?
Uh, well, we, uh, we had to leave early. There was a, uh, slight monetary discrepancy regarding the bill.
Well I've never met your sister but obviously these are not hard-and-fast rules.  Darling, the tea is getting a little cold sweetheart.
Alright, let's just get to work.  NBC Pilot, Seinfeld project. Act I, Scene A.
